definitions: small medicated candy designed to dissolve slowly in the mouth for throat relief
geometric figure with four equal sides in a diamond orientation
examples: She sucked on a lozenge to soothe her sore throat
The cough lozenges helped him get through the presentation
The pattern featured alternating lozenges in blue and gold
Medieval shields often displayed heraldic lozenges as symbols

definitions: oily or greasy substance used to reduce friction between moving parts
examples: The mechanic applied lube to the squeaky door hinges
Don't forget to buy engine lube when you change the oil

definitions: substance like oil or grease that reduces friction between surfaces in contact
examples: The machine requires a special high-temperature lubricant for optimal performance
Water can act as a natural lubricant between sliding surfaces

definitions: process of applying substances to reduce friction and wear between moving parts
examples: Regular lubrication extends the life of mechanical equipment significantly
The engine needs proper lubrication to prevent overheating and damage

definitions: purple-flowered plant grown as animal feed, also known as alfalfa
examples: The farmer planted lucerne to provide nutritious feed for cattle
Fields of lucerne stretched across the valley in purple blooms

definitions: quality of being easily understood or having clear, rational thoughts and perceptions
examples: The patient showed remarkable lucidity despite her advanced age
He explained the complex theory with admirable lucidity and precision

definitions: old-fashioned term for a friction match used to start fires
name for Satan or the devil in Christian tradition
examples: He struck a lucifer to light the oil lamp
The box of lucifers was kept away from children
In the poem, Lucifer represents pride and rebellion
Medieval paintings often depicted Lucifer falling from heaven

definitions: simple board game where players race colored pieces around a cross-shaped track
examples: The children spent rainy afternoons playing ludo together
Ludo requires both luck with dice and strategic piece movement

definitions: projecting piece on machinery or containers used for gripping or attachment
act of carrying or dragging something heavy with effort
examples: The wheel has five lugs for attaching it securely
Tighten all the lugs before driving the vehicle
We had to lug our suitcases up three flights
The lug of heavy equipment tired everyone out quickly

definitions: small one or two-person sled used for racing down ice tracks
examples: The Olympic luge competition features speeds over 80 mph
She trained for years to master the luge technique

definitions: semi-automatic pistol originally manufactured in Germany, widely used in both world wars
examples: The museum displayed a vintage Luger from World War I
Collectors prize original Lugers for their historical significance

definitions: bags and suitcases used to carry personal belongings while traveling
examples: Please check your luggage at the airline counter
The hotel porter helped carry their luggage to the room

definitions: temporary period of quiet or reduced activity in normally busy situations
examples: There was a brief lull in the storm before it intensified
The afternoon lull gave employees time to catch up

definitions: gentle song sung to help babies or children fall asleep
examples: Her mother sang the same lullaby every night at bedtime
The soft lullaby drifted through the nursery window

definitions: something or someone remarkable, outstanding, or particularly difficult to handle
examples: That last math problem was a real lulu
The storm they predicted turned out to be a lulu

definitions: wood that has been processed into boards or planks for construction
heavy, awkward movement typical of large animals or tired people
examples: The construction site received a delivery of pine lumber
They need more lumber to complete the deck project
The bear lumbered through the forest looking for food
After the long hike, we lumbered back to camp

definitions: business or process of cutting down trees and preparing timber for sale
slow, heavy, and awkward way of moving
examples: Lumbering was the main industry in the northern forests
Environmental concerns have changed modern lumbering practices
The elephant's lumbering gait shook the ground beneath
His lumbering attempts at dancing amused everyone

definitions: person whose job involves cutting down trees and preparing logs
examples: The lumberjack wore flannel shirts and heavy boots
Traditional lumberjacks used axes before chainsaws were invented

definitions: person who works in the lumber industry, cutting or selling timber
examples: The lumberman inspected each board for quality defects
Several generations of lumbermen worked in those forests

definitions: measure of brightness or light intensity emitted from a surface per unit area
examples: The screen's luminance can be adjusted for comfortable viewing
Scientists measured the luminance of different light sources

definitions: person who inspires others or is prominent in a particular field
natural body or object that gives off light
examples: She became a luminary in the field of medicine
Several luminaries attended the scientific conference
The moon is Earth's most visible nocturnal luminary
Ancient people worshipped celestial luminaries like the sun

definitions: emission of light by a substance not caused by heat, including fluorescence and phosphorescence
examples: The jellyfish displayed beautiful blue luminescence in the dark water
Certain minerals show luminescence under ultraviolet light

definitions: quality of being bright or giving off light, or total energy radiated
examples: The star's luminosity could be seen from millions of miles away
Artists often comment on the luminosity of his paintings

definitions: compact mass of something without regular shape
swelling or bump under the skin or on a surface
examples: She added a lump of sugar to her tea
The dough formed lumps that needed more mixing
The doctor examined the lump on his neck carefully
A large lump appeared after he bumped his head

definitions: extreme foolishness or mental instability, originally thought to be influenced by the moon
examples: It would be sheer lunacy to attempt that dangerous climb
The committee rejected his proposal as complete lunacy

definitions: person who is mentally ill or behaves in an extremely foolish way
examples: Only a lunatic would try swimming in those conditions
The driver acted like a complete lunatic on the highway

definitions: formal lunch or midday meal, often for business or special occasions
examples: The charity luncheon raised thousands for the local hospital
Business executives gathered for the annual awards luncheon

definitions: time of day when lunch is typically eaten, usually around noon
examples: The office gets crowded at lunchtime every weekday
Let's meet in the park during lunchtime tomorrow

definitions: sudden forward movement of the body, typically to attack or reach something
examples: The fencer made a quick lunge toward his opponent
She made a desperate lunge for the falling vase

definitions: plant with tall spikes of colorful flowers, grown ornamentally and for seeds
examples: Purple and pink lupins lined the garden pathway beautifully
Wild lupins covered the hillside in early summer

definitions: characteristic resembling or relating to wolves
alternate spelling of lupin, a flowering plant
examples: The dog's lupine features revealed its wolf ancestry
His lupine howl echoed through the mountain valley
The garden featured several varieties of colorful lupine
Lupine seeds can be toxic if not properly prepared

definitions: abrupt, unsteady movement or stagger, often of vehicles or people
examples: The bus gave a sudden lurch as it hit the pothole
He felt his stomach lurch when the plane dropped

definitions: something that attracts or tempts, especially artificial bait for catching fish
examples: The fisherman tried different lures to catch bass
Free samples were used as a lure to attract customers

definitions: person who drinks alcohol excessively or is often drunk
characterized by rich, abundant, or luxuriant growth
examples: The old lush stumbled out of the bar
He was known as the neighborhood lush
The lush tropical vegetation created a green paradise
Her lush garden was the envy of the neighborhood

definitions: very strong sexual desire or intense craving for something
examples: His lust for power corrupted his judgment completely
The novel explored themes of love and lust

definitions: gentle sheen or soft glow on a surface, especially from reflected light
examples: The pearl's natural luster made it extremely valuable
Years of polishing restored the silver's original luster

definitions: British spelling of luster, meaning soft glow or shine on a surface
examples: The silk fabric had a beautiful lustre in the light
The diamond's lustre indicated its high quality

definitions: plucked string instrument with a rounded body, popular in medieval and Renaissance music
examples: The minstrel played a haunting melody on his lute
Renaissance paintings often depict angels playing lutes

definitions: unit of illumination equal to one lumen per square meter
examples: The office lighting measured 500 lux at desk level
Photography studios require precise lux measurements for consistency

definitions: state of great comfort and extravagant living involving great expense
examples: They enjoyed every luxury the resort had to offer
For many people, eating out is considered a luxury

definitions: small round tropical fruit with translucent white flesh and a large seed
examples: Fresh lychees have a sweet, floral taste unlike canned ones
The lychee tree produces fruit once a year

definitions: strongly alkaline solution used in soap-making and cleaning, historically made from wood ash
examples: Traditional soap makers still use lye in their recipes
Be extremely careful when handling lye as it burns skin

definitions: practice of deliberately telling untruths or false statements
state of being in a flat or horizontal position
examples: His constant lying destroyed all trust in the relationship
The detective specialized in detecting lying during interrogations
The books were lying scattered across the floor
After lying in bed all day, she felt stiff

definitions: clear fluid containing white blood cells that circulates through the lymphatic system
examples: The lymph nodes filter harmful substances from the lymph
Swollen glands indicate lymph is fighting an infection

definitions: cancer that begins in infection-fighting cells of the immune system called lymphocytes
examples: The patient was diagnosed with non-Hodgkin's lymphoma last year
Modern treatments have improved survival rates for lymphoma significantly

definitions: killing someone illegally by mob action, especially by hanging, historically associated with racial violence
examples: The museum exhibit documented the history of lynching in America
Anti-lynching laws were finally passed after decades of activism

definitions: medium-sized wild cat with tufted ears, spotted fur, and large padded paws
examples: The lynx silently stalked its prey through the snow
Canada lynx have especially large paws for walking on snow

definitions: stringed instrument like a small harp used in ancient Greece and Rome
examples: Apollo was often depicted playing a golden lyre
The poet accompanied herself on the lyre while reciting
